org.opends.server.replication.server

Class ReplicationServerDomain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.api.MonitorProvider<MonitorProviderCfg>
      • org.opends.server.replication.server.ReplicationServerDomain

  • public class ReplicationServerDomain
extends MonitorProvider<MonitorProviderCfg>
    This class define an in-memory cache that will be used to store the messages that have been received from an LDAP server or from another replication server and that should be forwarded to other servers. The size of the cache is set by configuration. If the cache becomes bigger than the configured size, the older messages are removed and should they be needed again must be read from the backing file it runs a thread that is responsible for saving the messages received to the disk and for trimming them Decision to trim can be based on disk space or age of the message

      Creates a new ReplicationServerDomain associated to the DN baseDn.

        destination - The destination of this message.
        Returns:

        Send a TopologyMsg to all the connected directory servers in order to let them know the topology (every known DSs and RSs).

      • buildAndSendTopoInfoToRSs

        public void buildAndSendTopoInfoToRSs()
        Send a TopologyMsg to all the connected replication servers in order to let them know our connected LDAP servers.

      • createTopologyMsgForRS

        public TopologyMsg createTopologyMsgForRS()
        Creates a TopologyMsg filled with information to be sent to a remote RS. We send remote RS the info of every DS that are directly connected to us plus our own info as RS.
        Returns:
        A suitable TopologyMsg PDU to be sent to a peer RS

      • createTopologyMsgForDS

        public TopologyMsg createTopologyMsgForDS(int destDsId)
        Creates a TopologyMsg filled with information to be sent to a DS. We send remote DS the info of every known DS and RS in the topology (our directly connected DSs plus the DSs connected to other RSs) except himself. Also put info related to local RS.
        Parameters:
        destDsId - The id of the DS the TopologyMsg PDU is to be sent to and that we must not include in the DS list.
        Returns:
        A suitable TopologyMsg PDU to be sent to a peer DS

      • initGenerationID

        public void initGenerationID(long generationId)
        Initialize the value of the generationID for this ReplicationServerDomain. This method is intended to be used for initialization at startup and simply stores the new value without any additional processing. For example it does not clear the change-log DBs
        Parameters:
        generationId - The new value of generationId.

        savedStatus - The saved status of the generationId.

                         ReplicationServerHandler handler,

                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  DirectoryException
        Process topology information received from a peer RS.
        Parameters:

        handler - The handler that received the message.
        allowResetGenId - True for allowing to reset the generation id ( when called after initial handshake)

      • getChangeTimeHeartbeatState

        public ServerState getChangeTimeHeartbeatState()
        Return the state that contain for each server the time of eligibility.
        Returns:
        the state.

      • getEligibleState

        public ServerState getEligibleState(ChangeNumber eligibleCN)
        Computes the eligible server state for the domain. s1 s2 s3 -- -- -- cn31 cn15 ----------------------------------------- eligibleCN cn14 cn26 cn13 The eligibleState is : s1;cn14 / s2;cn26 / s3;cn31
        Parameters:
        eligibleCN - The provided eligibleCN.
        Returns:
        The computed eligible server state.

      • getStartState

        public ServerState getStartState()
        Returns the start state of the domain, made of the first (oldest) change stored for each serverId. Note: Because the replication changelogdb trimming always keep one change whatever its date, the change contained in the returned state can be very old.
        Returns:
        the start state of the domain.

      • getEligibleCN

        public ChangeNumber getEligibleCN()
        Returns the eligibleCN for that domain - relies on the ChangeTimeHeartbeat state. For each DS, take the oldest CN from the changetime heartbeat state and from the changelog db last CN. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the eligible CN.

      • processChangeTimeHeartbeatMsg

        public void processChangeTimeHeartbeatMsg(ServerHandler senderHandler,
                                 ChangeTimeHeartbeatMsg msg)
        Processes a ChangeTimeHeartbeatMsg received, by storing the CN (timestamp) value received, and forwarding the message to the other RSes.
        Parameters:
        senderHandler - The handler for the server that sent the heartbeat.
        msg - The message to process.

      • storeReceivedCTHeartbeat

        public void storeReceivedCTHeartbeat(ChangeNumber cn)
        Store a change time value received from a data server.
        Parameters:
        cn - The provided change time.

      • getEligibleCount

        public long getEligibleCount(ServerState startState,
                    ChangeNumber endCN)
        This methods count the changes, server by server : - from a serverState start point - to (inclusive) an end point (the provided endCN).
        Parameters:
        startState - The provided start server state.
        endCN - The provided end change number.
        Returns:
        The number of changes between startState and endCN.

      • getEligibleCount

        public long getEligibleCount(ChangeNumber startCN,
                    ChangeNumber endCN)
        This methods count the changes, server by server : - from a start CN - to (inclusive) an end point (the provided endCN).
        Parameters:
        startCN - The provided start changeNumber.
        endCN - The provided end change number.
        Returns:
        The number of changes between startTime and endCN.

      • getLatestDomainTrimDate

        public long getLatestDomainTrimDate()
        Get the latest (more recent) trim date of the changelog dbs associated to this domain.
        Returns:
        The latest trim date.
